sub_title: MedTech AI Entrepreneur, CEO, and Strategic Advisor specializing in novel AI clinical applications and technology
summary:
Bart Hendriks’s 20+ years of experience is distinguished by successes in delivering breakthrough outcomes for healthcare AI, medical technology, and life science companies and in creating value for their customers.

During his career, Bart has been brought in by founders, investors, and C-suite executives of companies to improve business performance. In each assignment, he quickly adapted to complex challenges including startup and turnaround situations and was at the forefront of global strategies, partnerships, and teams that have delivered dynamic results. His background includes being at the helm of marketing and selling AI and Big Data solutions nearly a decade before they became commonplace.

With global experience spanning Europe, the Middle East, Brazil, Russia, India, and China, Bart easily connects with strategic partners and customers of diverse cultures and backgrounds. He is effective at winning new business, expanding an existing business, and driving substantial revenue, market share and profit growth by utilizing his vast network of contacts and building new connections and partnerships.

Signature Achievements:
- Won multimillion-dollar strategic contract in 24 months for a publicly traded company.
- Spearheaded setup of a company in Europe and Russia Federation with minimal funding and brought it to profitability from day 1, outpacing U.S. headquarters team and capturing its largest single multimillion-dollar strategic contract.
- Built and scaled up a publicly traded company in Europe from startup and $0 in revenue to several regional offices and €30M+ in revenue in 3 years.
- Played a key role in driving the highest annual revenue, margin, and new business growth (600+%) in a company’s history.

Skills:
Strategic Planning
Strategy & Business Model Development
Startup & Turnaround Leadership
Change Management
Global Sales & Marketing Management
New Business Development
Strategic Partner Development
Team Building & Leadership

authors.headline: MedTech AI Entrepreneur, CEO, and Strategic Advisor specializing in novel AI clinical applications and technology

profile_positions.description: Digital twins have emerged as transformative innovations in the healthcare sector. A prominent application of digital twins in healthcare is the creation of patient-specific simulations. By developing virtual replicas of an individual’s disease – reflecting their unique physiological characteristics, medical history, and genetic information – healthcare professionals can gain valuable insights and make more informed decisions about patient care. These virtual models allow for testing various treatment options in a risk-free environment, thus aiding in personalizing and optimizing medical treatments. Digital twins can help predict and monitor disease progression, simulate the effects of different medications, and provide real-time feedback on treatment outcomes. By leveraging digital twins, healthcare providers can enhance patient outcomes and offer more precise, individualized care. What sets Twinome Health apart is its capability to continually integrate new patient data into the digital twin, enabling more accurate predictions akin to weather forecasting. In contrast, other patient clinical decision support approaches are static, based on a single moment. Twinome Health adopts a longitudinal approach, tracking the patient throughout their treatment.
profile_positions.title: co-Founder and CEO

profile_positions.description:
Vaccines were instrumental in controlling – even eliminating – some of the world’s deadliest diseases. Anesthetics enabled surgery to be commonplace and significantly safer. AI is the next revolution in healthcare, enabling a step-change in efficiency, cost-reduction and bringing better health to more people.

Vigor has been set up to make AI adoption as easy and as impactful as possible for the world’s healthcare professionals and healthcare systems. Vigor’s global platform offers an independent, curated marketplace that fast-forwards the decision-making process. After all, you’re specialists in healthcare, not IT. And by leveraging AI technology from multiple continents, we can provide a level of quality and true scalability at price points that are (dare we say?) … invigorating.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder & CEO

profile_positions.description:
Bart Hendriks is The Dawning – the best chance medtech founders and investors have of bringing an innovation successfully to market. An experienced pathfinder, Bart’s unique combination of unstoppable energy and enthusiasm, his talent for putting theory into practice, and his unparalleled network are behind the success of innumerable startups.

For investors, Bart not only ensures your best ROI… he is your best ROI. The Dawning. Because the route to market is a jungle.
profile_positions.title: Experienced Motivational & Inspirational Pathfinder

profile_positions.description:
Due diligence of health tech start, and scale-ups. Improving value propositions and results of health tech start-, scale-ups and turn arounds. 

What is healthcare tech? At its core, healthcare tech refers to technology-enabled products and services in healthcare. Distinct from medical devices and diagnostics, healthcare tech focuses on facilitating and enabling healthcare functions. 

Healthcare tech is a vast, hyper-fragmented field. Individual companies may serve a specific vertical, such as pharmaceuticals, medical technology, providers, or regulators, in a portion of that vertical’s value chain. In that context, individual companies usually fulfill a specific need, for example, digitizing core processes or providing digital health solutions. Healthcare tech companies can provide or facilitate anything from electronic medical records to clinical trial management software.

Due diligence for a start/scale-up is something of a contradiction in terms if you think about it. It’s a process that aims to give the technical, legal and financial grounds upon which a startup can gain investor support. Yet the process of getting a start/scale-up due diligence portfolio up and running is a labor intensive and greatly time consuming one that start/scale-ups, trying to keep margins narrow, often lack the resources to properly do. With a reported 47% of investments in startups falling through due to unsatisfactory due diligence, how is a company to beat the resources conundrum? How is a startup to get its ducks in a row to land an investment?

The answer lies in the value of knowing the due diligence craft. Knowledge is power and knowing how to prep accounts for half of your potential success.

[Due diligence | Health tech | AI | Medical Device | Life Sciences | serial Rainmaker]
profile_positions.title: Founder & CEO

profile_positions.description:
Setting the foundation of, and managing the Philips Healthcare Third Party Product Portfolio within the Procurement Solutions & Services group, creating new and innovative health tech propositions with a lasting global impact.

profile_positions.title: Global Portfolio Manager Third Party Products & Services (Procurement S&S)

profile_positions.description:
Brought in by founder and two angel investors of a company providing healthcare professionals with medical technology to improve the quality of care. Led efforts to drive sales and market share with key focus on building global partnerships.

Global Partnerships. Created new global partnerships and strengthened existing global partnerships. Key partnerships included Philips Healthcare, GE Healthcare, Siemens Healthineers, Toshiba Medical, Canon Medical, Hitachi Medical, and Merck. 
CRM / Sales Funnel Growth. Implemented CRM system and increased funnel by 300% within 12 months.
Major Deal Wins. Secured substantial deal with major hospital in Rotterdam and initiated and initiated and managed large strategic contract with a global healthcare leader.

[Scale-up | Medical Device | E-Learning | SaaS]
profile_positions.title: SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT GLOBAL SALES (Interim Project)

profile_positions.description:
Tapped by investors to provide turnaround leadership for a company providing solutions for clinical and non-clinical diagnostic needs and life sciences research. RiverD is a spin-out of the Erasmus Medical Center in Rotterdam, The Netherlands. Company has 16 fulltime employees at one location. Workplace Culture. Acknowledged as an energetic and enthusiastic leader who fostered a positive, dynamic workplace culture.

Cost Reductions. Reduced product costs by 25% and service costs by 50%.
Outsourcing & Product Improvements. Outsourced majority of production to specialized partner to improve product quality, flexibility, and ability to scale if needed.
Business Planning / USP & IP Conversion. Developed business plan for converting USP’s (including IP) used in skincare to the same technology for cancer-related surgery.
Funnel Growth. Grew funnel to 250% backlog in 2 years.

[SME | MedTech | Life Sciences | Molecular Analysis]
profile_positions.title: CHIEF COMMERCIAL OFFICER

profile_positions.description:
Providing guidance related to market access and M&A potential on request of the shareholders and management.

[SME | Life Sciences | Tissue Engineering]
profile_positions.title: A-SKIN TISSUE ENGINEERING NON EXECUTIVE SUPERVISORY BOARD MEMBER

profile_positions.description:
Asked by the CEO and VP Sales and Marketing to join Intrasense based on earlier positive track record with similar companies. Intrasense develops and markets computer software for the review and analysis of medical images, including Myrian®, an innovative software platform for visualization and treatment of advanced 3D medical images from all types of imaging equipment for the diagnosis, treatment planning, and follow-up of Pathologies. Company has 100 fulltime employees at 4 global locations in the U.S., France, and Japan. Continually traveled to Paris, Montpelier and Dutch office and visited customers in North America, Europe, Asia and APAC.

Strategic Partnerships. Created, nurtured, and converted strategic partner relationships to high-value projects. Re-established important relationships with partners, including Toshiba Medical Systems. Cultivated new partnerships with Hitachi Medical Systems and Sectra AB (publicly traded companies).
Sales & Marketing Leadership. Led sales and marketing functions and managed global commercial team (excluding direct sales team in North America) when VP left the company.
Revenue Revitalization. Halted revenue decline and improved revenue results by 78% within 2 years.
CRM. Implemented salesforce CRM system that increased backlog value growth by 200% in 2 years.
Contract Management. Directed, managed, and executed a global multimillion-dollar contract with Sectra AB.

[SME | MedTech | Healthcare Informatics software | AI | Clinical Applications]
profile_positions.title: VP STRATEGIC GLOBAL PARTNERSHIPS

profile_positions.description:
Selected by Chairman of the Board and investors for interim assignment to spearhead a turnaround of the company (Expat living in the U.K. during this period). Bioxydn Ltd. is a Manchester University spin-out that provides MRI based imaging services and products to pharmaceutical and biotech companies worldwide.

Corporate Repositioning. Redesigned strategy (including business plan) to reposition company from low value/low potential COPD to high-value Cystic Fibrosis with value proposition centered on non-radiating MR scans using oxygen as contrast to pharmaceutical and medical device industry.
Strategic Relationships. Established strategic relationships with cystic fibrosis stakeholders (including pharmaceutical and insurance companies and key opinion leaders) and introduced company and its USP/IPs to global market leaders (e.g., Siemens Healthineers, Philips Medical, Hitachi Medical, Canon Medical, Neusoft, and Toshiba Medical).
Sales Funnel Development, CRM & Project Pipeline. Developed sales funnel from ground-up (including hiring Dutch Specialists, selected and implemented CRM system, and improved Clinical Trial Phase-I and II project pipeline.

[Scale-up | Life Sciences | AI | Clinical Applications]
profile_positions.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, a.i. COO (Interim Project)

volunteer_experiences.description: Founded to help fellow entrepreneurs in 3rd world countries by investing one day per holiday or business trip to be their personal coach and business adviser. There is so much you can do in such a short time frame it is almost criminal not doing it.

The Paris Business Club Amsterdam (CAPA) is an initiative of French and Dutch companies that want to develop, boost and strengthen business relations between France and the Netherlands.

The Paris Business Club Amsterdam brings together French partners who have links with or who are settled in the Netherlands and Dutch people working in France. Members of the 'Business Club' can exchange their knowledge and experiences.

One of CAPA's objectives is to develop and strengthen cooperation between Dutch companies established in France (or wishing to set up operations there).

And more generally, the Business Club wishes to stimulate Franco-Dutch business relations in France.

Gerson Lehrman Group (GLG) is a New York-based platform for professional learning that markets itself as a "learning membership connecting businesspeople trying to solve problems to experts that can solve them". The firm connects its clients with independent contractor consultants with topical or industry expertise in a variety of fields (termed "Council Members"), as well as executive education, larger team training, and the placement of experts in long-term advisory, operational, and board roles.
